content.description: Sit start the left arete on crimps, and move up and slightly left to top out.
content.location: From the problem Pulse on the back of the Lone Wolf Boulder, walk downhill at about 2 o'clock for a minute or two to find this block.

content.description: Stand start with a right undercling and a left crimp on the lip. Move up and right to a sketchy topout.
content.location: This is the perched boulder about 25 feet left of the Lone Wolf Boulder.
This is on the way between the Manatee Boulder and the Lone Wolf Boulder.

content.description: Stand start with a left gaston crimp and move up. Hard.
content.location: This climbs the steep, undercut, back arete.

content.description: Sit start the far right arete, and traverse left across the steepness to a slopey topout.
content.location: Facing the problem Pulse on the Lone Wolf Boulder, walk to your left at about 10 o'clock for about 2-3 minutes to locate this block perched up on the hillside.

pathTokens: Cavalry Boulder Field aka Gymnasium aka Playground

content.description:
This is the impressive granite boulder that appears on your right in a kind of woodland clearing as you continue along the Extensions trail and shortly after passing Extensions 1.  

  I believe this may be the boulder listed as Lone Wolf in Boston Rocks II, but it does not fit the author's GPS or location descriptions.  

  As you walk around all four sides, you will find that its walls offer little in the way of holds but are more than generous in their display of lichen. 

  A thorough cleaning will be in order before any climbing can be done on the steep, slabby North face.
